article.name: Phish Alert Button (PAB) Test Email Overview
article.title: Phish Alert Button (PAB) Test Email Overview
article.body:
After you’ve installed the Phish Alert Button (PAB), you can send your users a test email so they can test their PAB.

Using this template can help you verify that your PAB is working correctly and that your users know how to use it.

To send a test email for the PAB, you’ll need to first create a phishing campaign by following the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 console and click the Phishing tab.
  2. Then, click the + Create Phishing Campaign button at the top-right corner of the page.
  3. On the New Phishing Campaign page that displays, match the below-recommended fields and settings.
    1. Campaign Name: Enter a name for your campaign, such as “PAB Test”. This field is required.
    2. Send to: Select either All Users or Specific Groups. If you choose Specific Groups, you must select a group from the drop-down menu. This field is required.
    3. Template Topics: Select Phish Alert Button Test.
    4. Template Selection: Select Specific Template (Choose one template).
    5. Specific Template: Select Phish Alert Button Test (PAB) (Not PST) (Spoofs Domain).
    6. Frequency: Select how often you would like to send PAB tests for this campaign. If you select One-time, this campaign will send one test to each user and then finish. We recommend selecting either Bi-weekly or Monthly.
    7. Start Time: Set the date, time, and time zone you would like your PAB tests to start. Your default time zone is the one set in your account settings.
    8. Sending Period: Select Send emails over, 1, and weeks. For more information about sending and tracking periods, see our Monitor and Review Phishing Campaigns article.
    9. Define Business Days and Hours: By default, your campaign will only send PAB tests during the business hours set in your account settings. You can change the hours your emails are sent by entering a start and end time in the corresponding fields. You can also choose what days you would like emails to be sent by selecting the date check boxes.
    10. Track Activity: Select 3 and days. For more information about sending and tracking periods, see our Monitor and Review Phishing Campaigns article.
    11. Hide from Reports: Select this check box to hide this test campaign.
    Note:Any settings not specified above can remain at their default values.

  4. After you’ve finished entering your settings, click Create Campaign.

images.alt:
This image displays the configuration interface for an email phishing test template titled **"Phish Alert Button Test (Not PST) (Spoofs Domain)."**

**Metadata and Controls:**
*   The top left includes a language selector dropdown currently set to **"English - United States."**
*   The top right displays the unique identifier: **"Template ID: SA143-39592."**

**Email Header Configuration (Left Panel):**
The standard email fields are displayed with pre-set variables:
*   **From:** `PAB Test <knowbe4@[[domain]]>`
*   **Reply-To:** `PAB Test <knowbe4@[[domain]]>`
*   **Subject:** `Phish Alert Button Test`

**Testing Module (Right Panel):**
A test functionality panel allows for instant testing:
*   Two empty input fields are provided, placeholder labeled **"email"** and **"domain."**
*   A blue button labeled **"Send Me a Test Email"** (preceded by a mail icon) initiates the test send using the specified parameters.

**Email Body Content (Template Preview):**
The body text is a structured instructional message using personalization placeholders:
*   Greeting: `Hi [[first_name]],`
*   Content: The message identifies the sender as **"[[company_name]]'s security awareness training provider, KnowBe4,"** and instructs the recipient to use the **"Phish Alert Button (PAB)"** on the email to confirm functionality.
*   Instructions: A follow-up paragraph advises users experiencing issues to **"please contact your IT team or manager for further assistance."**
*   Closing: `Thank you!`

This document describes the user interface configuration for setting up a "New Phishing Campaign."

## Campaign Configuration Details

The interface is structured as a single form with multiple configuration sections. A preliminary note indicates: "A campaign will start 10 minutes after it is activated or created."

### Campaign Setup
*   **(a) Campaign Name:** Input field is populated with "PAB Test."
*   **(b) Send to:** Configured to "All Users" (selected via button toggle). "Specific Groups" is the alternative option.

### Phishing Templates
*   **(c) Template Topics:** Configured with one tag: "Phish Alert Button Test."
*   Difficulty Rating: Set to "All Ratings" (dropdown).
*   **(d) Template Selection:** Set to "Specific Template (Choose one template)."
*   **(e) Specific Template:** Dropdown is set to "Phish Alert Button Test (PAB) (Not PST) (Spoofs Domain)." A "Preview" link is available next to the selection.

### Phishing Link
*   Phish Link Domain: Dropdown set to "Random Domain."
*   Landing Page: Dropdown set to "Default Landing Pages."

### Delivery Details
*   **(f) Frequency:** Set to "One-time" (selected button). Other options are Weekly, Biweekly, Monthly, and Quarterly.
*   **(g) Start Time:** Set to 10/24/2025 10:11 AM, using the timezone (GMT-04:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada).
*   **(h) Sending Period:** The option "Send emails over [1] [weeks]" is selected.
*   **(i) Define Business Days and Hours:** Business hours are set from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. The days selected are Monday through Friday (Mon, Tues, Wed, Thur, Fri).

### Failure Tracking
*   Track Replies to Phishing Emails: Unchecked checkbox.
*   **(j) Track Activity:** Configured to track activity for "3 days" after the sending period ends.
*   Add Clickers to: Dropdown placeholder indicates "Please select."

### Reporting
*   Send an email report to account admins after each phishing test: Unchecked checkbox.
*   **(k) Hide from Reports:** Unchecked checkbox.

### Real-Time Coaching
*   Send SecurityTips that reveal missed Social Engineering Indicators for phishing failures: Unchecked checkbox.

The configuration is concluded with a primary action button labeled **"Create Campaign."**
